content.raw:
@meha27 , could you pull from the OSRF repository and merge the branch with yours? The live version has everything under a lower-cased [directory](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/src/925b1d638ca7657475b1110bc21789ef8cdb3788/joints/?at=Joints) `joints`.

You should be able to do it like this:

~~~
hg up Joints
hg pull #!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials -b Joints
hg merge          (make sure the merge is correct and all the latest files are under the correct directory)
hg commit -m "message here"
~~~
content.html:
@meha27 , could you pull from the OSRF repository and merge the branch with yours? The live version has everything under a lower-cased directory joints.

You should be able to do it like this:

hg up Joints
hg pull #!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials -b Joints
hg merge          (make sure the merge is correct and all the latest files are under the correct directory)
hg commit -m "message here"
